articleContent.title: Chord: Major 7th in E (Shape: G)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: Major 7th in E (Shape: G)  

## Brief Description:  
The Major 7th chord in the key of E is commonly played using the G shape on the guitar. It is a rich and colorful chord that adds a jazzy and sophisticated sound to compositions and improvisations.  

## Notes and Intervals:  
- E (Root)  
- G# (Major 3rd)  
- B (Perfect 5th)  
- D# (Major 7th)  

## Genre and Flavor:  
The Major 7th chord in E is often used in jazz, R&B, and neo-soul genres. It adds a smooth and dreamy quality to music, creating a sense of sophistication and emotion. This chord is versatile and can evoke feelings of nostalgia, romance, and introspection in a musical piece.  

## Songs:  
1. "Don't Know Why" by Norah Jones  
2. "Isn't She Lovely" by Stevie Wonder  
3. "Gravity" by John Mayer
